messageBody:
Thanks a lot!

But here's the problem: What I am trying to do is to create a junit
generator for idl file. If don't using idl2java, how to implement
such generator? If using idl2java, is there any possible that this
generator be used to test both client and server?

Please... give me a clue!!!



--- In junit@y..., Ruslan Shevchenko <Ruslan@S...> wrote:
> yjin68@y... wrote:
> >
> > Greetings,
> >
> > Is anyone have an idea of using junit to test CORBA IDL? I think
The
> > TestSuite just accept *.class file, since CORBA IDL is
specification,
> > how can I use Junit to test IDL? Someone help me out!
> >
>
> You want test server ?
>
> In this case you can use java client stubs, generated by
> idl2java compiler [name of IDL2Java is depend from ORB using].
> J
>
> You must at testsuite at first init ORB, receive reference to
> server root object, than test java classes, which are generated
> according to IDL->Java mapping which can be found on OMG web site
>
http://www.omg.org/technology/documents/formal/omg_idl_to_java_languag
e_mapping.htm
>
>
> Hope, this helps.
>
>
